description.narrative: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: i. Greater availability, affordability & accessibility of mobile services: Mobile Virtual Network Operators ("MVNOs") contribute towards expanding reach, lowering the cost and increasing competition in mobile telephony. Besides voice services, VMLA''s product offering will support further expansion of mobile broadband, particularly in niche markets that have not been successfully served by traditional Mobile Network Operators ("MNOs"). Particularly, VMLA will target the youth market which has more limited purchasing power than other population segments. In this regards, VMLA is positioning itself as the first pan-LAC MVNO, targeting the youth sector with highly segmented and tailored voice and data offerings. ii. Efficiency gains in the telecom industry through the sharing of infrastructure: The concept behind MVNOs is the sharing of telecoms infrastructure with existing mobile network operations (i.e, VMC will use Movistar''s network to provide its services). The specialization enables the use of existing spare capacity for niche markets through the sharing of infrastructure, ultimately contributing to generate greater efficiencies of the telecom industry overall. iii. Greater availability of broadband services (mobile in this case) and innovation: Greater access to mobile broadband is expected to contribute towards improving productivity and generate economic efficiencies. The contributions of broadband connectivity to economic growth, and as a kick-starter of other innovative business models (e-health, e-education, e-commerce, etc.), are widely accepted.

Virgin Mobile Latin America (VMLA or the Sponsor) has Mobile Virtual Network Operator (MVNOs) licenses in Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Peru, and has filed for license in Uruguay, Bolivia, Brazil and Argentina. VMLA has recently launched operations in Chile. IFC will be providing up to US$11 million C loan to fund Virgin Mobile Chile SpA (VMC or the Company). VMC will be offering mobile phone services targeting the youth segment with a targeted offering that will expand mobile broadband usage with attractive data packages.
